sections.MISSION: Apache Troop conducts AT-4 weapons qualification on 30NOV23 at Range 105 in order to maintain proficiency and qualify Soldiers on the weapon system.
sections.PURPOSE: Provide training to allow soldiers the opportunity to become fully certified on the AT-4 weapon system further increasing the lethality of the individual solider and the platoon.
sections.KEY TASKS:
Recon the site Maximize dry fire training IOT compensate for limited ammunition Conduct PMI on assigned weapon system before training Qualify firers on their weapon system
Reference: TM3-23.25 (FM3-23.25)
sections.EXECUTION:
This phase begins when range is wet and ends when the range is cleared. Recovery: Starts with the return to the MP at Rose Barracks and ends with AAR.
5.

OIC: 1LT Karadayi

Ensure Soldiers attend PMI prior to qualifying on the AT-4
Uniform: Full Dragoon Standard

subtask.name: Conduct Dismounted Tactical Movement/Maneuver in and around wildlife.

subtasks.hazard: Injuries from encounters with wildlife such as foxes, wolves or deer

values: Brief soldiers on wildlife safety, animals will be left alone and not antagonized.
Safety briefing
OIC, NCOIC, RSO
Firer will fire in safe directions and will be controlled from behind by RSO/lane safeties
Firer will take all directions from the tower
Medic will be present at all times on the range and will have a dedicated CASEVCAC vehicle present. This vehicle will be marked appropriately.
OIC/RSO and medical team will rehearse evacuation SOPs.
OIC/RSO will brief all medical procedures with the medical team during range safety brief.
OIC will notify range control of any injury occurring on the range
Targetry will be placed between range fans
Muzzle awareness will be maintained at all times
Firer will be certified on load, unload and clearing procedures prior to firing on the range
Lane safeties will ensure safe firing techniques
Firing Lanes will be oriented across range, and none will be ahead or behind other lanes
- NCOIC gives all commands to upload weapons - Safeties Supervision - Safety clears weapon before leaving firing area - Leadership will ensure no two ranges are within each others’ firing lane
OIC, NCOIC, RSO

subtasks.hazard: Ignorance of load, unload, and clearing procedures

values: Weapons will remain on safe and unloaded until instructed by the NCOIC
Proper clearing procedures will be briefed, implemented, and supervised
- Firers certified on load, unload and clearing procedures prior to range.
OIC, NCOIC, RSO
Firers will identify range fans prior to firing
Safeties will ensure that weapons are oriented properly
All weapons will be inspected after clearing
All firers will be qualified on their assigned weapon, optics and lasers
- Safety Briefing - Safety Supervision - Team Leaders - Buddy Clear
OIC, NCOIC, RSO

subtasks.hazard: Burns/Abrasions from materials leaving the barrel

values: Medics will be at range to treat any burns or other minor injuries
- Leader awareness - Safety Briefing
OIC, NCOIC, RSO
Personnel will not move forward of firing position unless instructed to do so
- Communications will be maintained with Range Control
OIC, NCOIC, RSO

subtasks.hazard: Loss of Communication with Range Control

values: Range will immediately go to cold status until communication is resorted
Back up will be cell phone to Company and SQDN Offices, and to Range Control
- PCI’s/PCC’s - Leader awareness
OIC, NCOIC, RSO
All equipment will be secured and tied down appropriately
All leaders will put hands on all sensitive items prior to leaving the range
- PCI’s/PCC’s - Sensitive Items check before and after the range
OIC, NCOIC, RSO
All firers will ensure their back-blast area is clear prior to firing any rounds down range.
Range OIC/RSO conduct range safety brief prior to execution and explain/demonstrate the standard.
Lane safeties will ensure that they do not endanger themselves by standing in the back-blast area.
- Range Safety Briefing - Leader/Safety Awareness
OIC, NCOIC, RSO, Lane Safeties
Firing will cease on range until aircraft has left range area
Range Control will be notified of aircraft by OIC or RSO
- Range Safety Briefing - Leader Supervision
OIC, NCOIC, RSO
Firing will cease if wildlife enters the range area and commence once the range is clear of wildlife
- Range Safety Briefing
OIC, NCOIC, RSO

draw.overall_supervision_plan: RSO and OIC will orient soldiers to the range and conduct a safety brief. Soldiers will coach/safety each other on the firing line with NCO's safetying in a 1:1 ratio.
